hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Stress Flight-to-Quality via Stablecoin Inflows
hypothesis_content.statement: When transitioning from BEAR to STRESS regime, a surge in stablecoin exchange inflows (>$1.5B weekly) combined with declining open interest (-20%+) while BTC holds key support ($85K) creates a risk-off signal where short-term puts outperform, with IV expansion providing 3:1 risk/reward.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BEAR-to-STRESS transitions often involve capitulation events. Large stablecoin inflows indicate sidelined capital waiting for lower prices. Declining OI shows deleveraging. Combined with key support holding, this creates asymmetric opportunity for volatility plays as fear spikes.
entry_conditions: Regime transitions from BEAR to STRESS
Aggregate open interest declines >20% from recent high
BTC price holds above $85,000 support (weekly close)

exit_conditions.take_profit: IV increases by 50% OR BTC drops 8% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC rallies 5% above entry with declining IV

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 55% of signals result in increased volatility (IV expansion >25%) OR BTC rallies >10% within 14 days during STRESS regimes.
